title: Trump will likely visit California next week after his inauguration
shortDescription: Donald Trump told NBC News that he will likely travel to California next week after his inauguration to view the devastation caused by the wildfires.

title: Foreign leaders attending Trump's inauguration
shortDescription: Foreign leaders and CEOs are the invited guests of President-elect Donald Trump at his second inauguration.

title: Nelly to perform at Liberty Ball for Trump on Inauguration Day
shortDescription: American rapper and three-time Grammy award-winning artist Nelly will perform at the Liberty Ball on Inauguration Day.

title: Brazil court rejects Bolsonaro's bid to attend Trump's inauguration
shortDescription: Bolsonaro's lawyers filed an appeal claiming the politician had fully complied with the precautionary measures imposed on him by the Supreme Court.

title: Trump: TikTok 'likely' to get 90-day 'reprieve' from ban, NBC News says
shortDescription: Once he takes office on Monday, President-elect Donald Trump plans to give TikTok a 90-day 'reprieve' from a ban, he told NBC News on Saturday.

title: A look at Donald Trump's life and family before he takes office
shortDescription: Learn more about president-elect Donald Trump's life, children, and siblings before he takes office Monday.

title: What to know about Trump's 'victory rally' in DC before inauguration
shortDescription: On Sunday, President-elect Donald Trump is set to hold a 'victory rally' in Washington D.C., one day before his inauguration. Here's what to know.

title: Inaugurations through the years: See historical photos from FDR to Biden
shortDescription: President-elect Donald Trump is set to take the oath of office for a second time on Inauguration Day. Here's a look at photos from inaugurations past.

title: Grover Cleveland's grandson on Trump, his own 'weird' view of history
shortDescription: George Cleveland never knew his grandfather, who died in 1908. But with Donald Trump's return, Grover Cleveland is a big deal again.

title: Biden's education secretary talks FAFSA, the GOP, and what worries him
shortDescription: In an exit interview with USA TODAY, Education Secretary Miguel Cardona reflected on his agency's accomplishments – and its unpredictable future.

title: Biden's top civil rights enforcer bids 'bittersweet' farewell to DOJ
shortDescription: Kristen Clarke, the first Black woman chosen to be the nation's top civil rights enforcer, called leaving the DOJ 'a bittersweet moment.'

title: Civil rights leaders urge Trump to honor King's work, but brace for fight
shortDescription: In a rare happening, the King holiday falls on the same day as the presidential inauguration. Activists vow to continue the fight for civil rights.

title: Will Trump once again curtail U.S. refugee resettlement?
shortDescription: Refugee communities and agencies are bracing to see whether Trump again curtails the U.S. resettlement program.

title: MAGA Mary and the Trumpettes: Die-hard Trump fans cheer his return
shortDescription: As President-elect Donald Trump returns to the White House, MAGA fans are celebrating.

title: See the first inauguration in Capitol Rotunda
shortDescription: Ronald Reagan was the first president to be sworn into office inside the Capitol Rotunda because of extremely cold weather on Jan. 21, 1985. It will happen again on Jan. 20, 2025, for the second inauguration of Donald Trump.

title: Biden declares Equal Rights Amendment law; impact is unclear
shortDescription: Supporters say it is needed to protect against discrimination. Opponents argue the timetable to have it become part of the Constitution has passed.

title: Here's who will, won't be at Donald Trump's inauguration on Monday
shortDescription: Among those attending will be celebrities like Carrie Underwood and Lee Greenwood, politicians like Bill Clinton and Barack Obama and some world leaders.

title: Ignoring TikTok ban risky for tech giants, even if Trump wants to help
shortDescription: Even with any assurances from Donald Trump, companies like Apple, Google, and Oracle would be taking a risk by not complying with the TikTok ban.

title: IRS commissioner to resign on Trump's inauguration day
shortDescription: IRS Commissioner Danny Werfel will resign to preempt Donald Trump firing him. Trump had already nominated former GOP Rep. Billy Long to replace him.

title: Biden 'end of quote' clip misrepresented online | Fact check
shortDescription: Biden didn't say "end of quote" by accident. He read a quote by former President Dwight D. Eisenhower before switching back to his own words.

title: Nationwide protests planned for Trump inauguration
shortDescription: Liberal activists have planned protests ahead of Trump's inauguration, but numbers expected to be lower than the 2017 Women's March.

title: Bondi, Trump's choice to lead DOJ, earned millions in his sphere: form
shortDescription: Pam Bondi, Donald Trump's pick for attorney general, made $3 million from shares in Trump’s social media platform, Truth Social's, parent company.

title: Lt. Gov. Jon Husted to fill JD Vance's Ohio Senate seat
shortDescription: Lt. Gov. Jon Husted will fill Vice President-elect JD Vance's Senate seat and join new Sen. Bernie Moreno in Washington.
